channel.title: Cannot compile my "bin" folder
channel.description:
When i double click my compile which located in "bin", A blk window has come out and said "Javac : file not found :*. java Usage javac <options> <source files> use-help for a list of possible options press any key to continues "
When i edit the compiler, i found that "@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause "

item.title: Cannot compile my "bin" folder
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

Hey let me tip you… if you have just downloaded this source well…
get rid of it and try getting a flawless one instead. For instance, try a more… ‘beginner’ source. Like Delta.
But anyhow the problem might still be in your compiler or runserver

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot compile my "bin" folder
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Your compiler shouldn’t be in the “bin” folder (which is usually the location of the bytecode i.e .class files), put your compiler with your source files, i.e files that have the extension “.java”.

Read full topic

"Javac : file not found :*. java
Usage javac
use-help for a list of possible options
press any key to continues "

When i edit the compiler, i found that
"@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause "
